intro: Scirpus pauciflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flower bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clusters with tall, cylindrical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets. Scirpus pauciflorus plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
